title: NCLAT adjourns Byju’s case hearing to Oct 1
description: On August 14, the Supreme Court revived the insolvency case against Byju's, overturning National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) decision that had quashed the bankruptcy proceedings and approved the settlement agreement with the BCCI.
content: The Chennai bench of the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Thursday adjourned a case involving troubled edtech firm Byju’s and a group of its US lenders to October 1, citing that the Supreme Court is looking into the matter.The top court had last week agreed to hear an appeal by Glas Trust Co, which represents the US lenders, opposing a Rs 158-crore settlement arrived at between Byju’s parent Think & Learn and the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). It is expected to hear the matter on September 17.Glas Trust has alleged that the money paid by Riju Ravindran, brother of Byju’s founder Byju Raveendran, to settle the dispute with the BCCI is tainted.On August 14, the Supreme Court had revived the insolvency case against Byju's, overturning an NCLAT decision that had quashed the bankruptcy proceedings and approved the settlement agreement with the BCCI.Earlier, Glas Trust had moved the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) on September 4 against the insolvency resolution professional (IRP) for Byju’s. The matter involved Glas Trust's removal from the committee of creditors (CoC) by IRP Pankaj Srivastava.
